pyraa.targeting.py

targeting module targeting.py

This module contains functionality for differential corrections methods to target a design solution given constraints

Attention

Classes inherit simulation.Simulation

Authors

Drew Langford

Last Edit

Langford, 07/2022

class pyraa.targeting.Continuation(Xd_vars: list, Xc_dict: dict, dynamics: str, mu: float, e: float, eps: float = 1e-10)[source]

Continuation - class for implementation of solution continuation procedures

Parameters

  • Xd_vars (list of strs) --

    Vector of design variables, ['x', 'y', 'z', 'vx', 'vy', 'vz', 'T']

    Example -- Xd_vars = ['x', 'vy', 'T']

  • Xc_dict (dict) --

    Dictionary of constraint expressions, key -> variable, value -> constriant

    Key options: ['x', 'y', 'z', 'vx', 'vy', 'vz']

    Example -- {'y' : 0, 'vx' : 0}

  • dynamics (str) -- name of dynamical model, options: "CR3BP", "ER3BP"

  • mu (float) -- mass ratio of primaries

  • e (float) -- eccentricity

  • eps -- precision of targeting algorithm

Return type

None

save_cont(file_name)[source]

save_cont - saves the continuation algorithm solutions to an HDF5 file format

  • Attributes saved *

  • self.States

  • self.Ts

  • self.vals

  • self.vecs

  • self.nus

  • self.PCexp_array

Parameters

file_name (str) -- name of the file saved

start(S_g: list, T_g: float, iter_stop: Optional[int] = None, stop_dict: Optional[dict] = None, dXd0_sign: int = 1, step_size: float = 0.01, type: str = 'psuedo-arc')[source]

start - function begins the continuation procedure

Parameters

  • S_g (1x6 array) -- initial state vector

  • T_g (float) -- intitial time of propogation

  • iter_stop (int, optional) -- number of iterations to stop continuation

  • stop_dict (dict, optional) -- dict that specifies parameter or value to stop continuation

  • Xd0_sign (+/-1, optional) -- step direction of the first design vector value

  • step_size (float, optional) -- size of step to take between solutions

  • type (str, optional) -- type of continuation procedure, Options ['psuedo-arc']

class pyraa.targeting.Targeter(Xd_vars: list, Xc_dict: dict, dynamics: str, mu: float, e: float, eps: float)[source]

Targeter Class

Implements differential corrections algorithms for computing a trajectory that satisfies a set of constraints

Parameters

  • Xd_vars (list of strs) --

    Vector of design variables, ['x', 'y', 'z', 'vx', 'vy', 'vz', 'T']

    Example -- Xd_vars = ['x', 'vy', 'T']

  • Xc_dict (dict) --

    Dictionary of constraint expressions, key -> variable, value -> constriant

    Key options: ['x', 'y', 'z', 'vx', 'vy', 'vz']

    Example -- {'y' : 0, 'vx' : 0}

  • dynamics (str) -- name of dynamical model, options: "CR3BP", "ER3BP"

  • mu (float) -- mass ratio of primaries

  • e (float) -- eccentricity

  • eps -- precision of targeting algorithm

Return type

None

calc_eigenspec(S: list, T: float, half: bool = False, verbose: bool = True)[source]

calc_eigenspec - returns eigenvalues and vectors of state transition matrix matrix

Function propogates S for a time, T, and calculates eigenspectrum from last state transition matrix. This function implements a comparative algorithm for sorting the eigenvalues and eigen vectors. The sorting is based on the eigenvalue type and follows the general order: [unitary, complex, real]

Parameters

  • S (1x6 array) -- initial state vector

  • T (float) -- time of propogation

  • half (bool) -- if True, propogates for 2*T*, use-case is perpendicular crossing

  • verbose (bool) -- if True, prints eigenspectrum results

Return type

None

Assigns atributes

  • self.M -- monodromy matrix, 6x6 array

  • self.val_array -- eigenvalue array, sorted unitary, complex, real

  • self.vec_arary -- eigenvector array, sorted unitary, complex, real

  • self.nu_array -- nu value array, sorted unitary, complex, real

  • self.PCexp_array -- Poincare exponent array, sorted unitary, complex, real

  • self.num_U -- number of unitary eigenvalues

  • self.num_C -- number of complex eigenvalues

  • self.num_R -- number of real eigenvalues

calc_midstate(q_a: list, q_b: list)[source]

calc_midstate - calculates average state given two design variable arrays

Takes the saved solution, self.S, self.T and finds a new state that is between a new design variable, q_a and old deisgn variable q_b. This could be used for locating the state of a bifurcation.

Parameters

  • q_a (design variable array #1) --

  • q_b (design variable array #2) --

Returns

  • S_m (1x6 array) -- mid-state array

  • T_m (float) -- mid-propogation time

  • |dq| (float) -- the norm difference between S_m, T_m and the design variable arrays

plot_convergence()[source]

plot_convergence - plots the covergence of a solution, self.S, self.T

Parameters

None --

Return type

None

plot_sol(half=False, **args)[source]

plot_sol - plots solved solution using Simulation.plot_orbit

Parameters

  • half (bool) -- if True, plots for 2T

  • **args -- arguments passed Simulation.plot_orbit

solve(S_g: list, T_g: float, verbose: bool = True)[source]

solve - initiates the differential corrections algorithm

Parameters

  • S_g (1x6 array) -- Guess for initial state vector

  • T_g (float) -- Guess for propogation time

  • verbose (bool) -- if True, prints output of solver

Returns

  • self.S (1x6 array) -- Solved intitial state vector

  • self.T (float) -- Solved propogation time

Assigns atributes

  • self.S -- solved state

  • self.T -- solved time of propogation
